explanation: Warren claims he was in client meetings all Wednesday morning until 1 PM. But Clue 3 reveals his third client meeting was rescheduled to Thursday â€” he lied about being off-site the entire morning. With his second meeting likely ending around 10 AM, Warren had time to return to the office. Clue 2 shows the expense template was printed at 10:22 AM from an unassigned copy room workstation, and Clue 1 narrows the drop-off window to between 9:45 and 11:15 AM. Warren printed the forged report and slipped it into the finance inbox.
funFact: Expense report fraud accounts for roughly 15% of all occupational fraud cases, with a median loss of $33,000 per scheme according to the ACFE.
